msIdentifier.collection: John Frederick Lewis Collection of European Manuscripts

msContents.summary: This manuscript contains a Book of Hours, Use of Rome.

msItem.title: Book of Hours, Use of Rome
Hours of the Virgin, Use of Rome

supportDesc.foliation: Modern foliation in pencil upper corner recto

p.catchwords: Horizontal center of margin verso decorated with simple pen flourishes: fol. 21v; Vertical inner margin verso decorated with simple pen flourishes: fols. 31v, 41v, 51v, 61v, 71v, 81v, 91v, 101v, 111v, 121v, 131v, 141v, 151v

layoutDesc.layout: Frame-ruled in ink; one column of fifteen lines; written area: 58x40 mm

decoDesc.decoNote: Three historiated initials within full-page floral borders containing medallions of butterflies, birds, and deer in Ferrarase style: empty cross (fol. 80r), King David (fol. 85r), skull (fol. 105r); fourteen initials with marginal decoration in gold and colors; one-line and two-line initials in red and blue throughout with decorative pen flourishing, flowers, grotesque heads, flowers, and foliation; rubrication throughout
Inside front coverSignature, T. F. Richardson
Inside front coverManuscript description
[Flyleaf 3 verso]Inscription, "Domni Frncisci Carbicei Forliviensis ex Castro, anno 1602 Kalendas Maias Brixiae"

40rSeven line decorated initial D and border
44rSeven line decorated initial D and border

58rSeven line decorated initial C and border
80rSeven line historiated initial, empty cross, Initial O
80rFloral border containing medallions of butterflies and birds
81vDecorated initial and border

105rFloral border containing medallions of butterfly and deer
105rEight line historiated initial, Human skull, Initial D
147rDecorated initial and border
[Flyleaf 3 recto]Signature, Livia Costanza Caterina De' Medici

history.provenance: Francisco Carbicei of Forli, Brescia, 1602; Thomas F. Richardson, Boston; obtained in 1919 by John Frederick Lewis, Philadelphia; given by his widow, Anne Baker Lewis, to the Free Library of Philadelphia in 1936

keywords.term: Illumination of books and manuscripts, Gothic
